args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u v

/-- A placeholder definition of the fundamental group. In a full development this would be the
    usual fundamental group construction; here we keep it abstract so the file typechecks.
-/
def pi1 (X : Type u) [TopologicalSpace X] (x0 : X) : Type u := Unit

/-- The fundamental group of a product is the product of the fundamental groups. -/
theorem pi1_prod {X : Type u} {Y : Type v} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  (x0 : X) (y0 : Y) :
  pi1 (X × Y) (x0, y0) ≃ pi1 X x0 × pi1 Y y0 := by sorry

args.natural_language_statement: Translate into Lean4: Let X and Y be topological spaces with basepoints x0 ∈ X and y0 ∈ Y. Prove that π₁(X × Y, (x0, y0)) ≅ π₁(X,x0) × π₁(Y,y0). Use Mathlib import at the top. Use a placeholder definition of pi1 as PUnit.{u} so the file typechecks. End the theorem with := by sorry.

args.content:
import Mathlib

universe u v

/-- A placeholder definition of the fundamental group. In a full development this would be the
    usual fundamental group construction; here we keep it abstract so the file typechecks.
-/
def pi1 (X : Type u) [TopologicalSpace X] (x0 : X) : Type (max u v) := PUnit

/-- The fundamental group of a product is the product of the fundamental groups. -/
theorem pi1_prod {X : Type u} {Y : Type v} [TopologicalSpace X] [TopologicalSpace Y]
  (x0 : X) (y0 : Y) :
  pi1 (X × Y) (x0, y0) ≃ pi1 X x0 × pi1 Y y0 := by sorry
